javadoc: IsolatedEntryCodeSubModel (S-model) defines subroutines with a unique entry point, which may share code with other subroutines. Each entry- point may either be a source or called entry-point and is identified using the MultEntSubModel. This model extends the OverlapCodeSubModel, redefining the set of addresses contained within each subroutine. Unlike the OverlapCodeSubModel, the address set of a IsolatedEntryCodeSubModel subroutine is permitted to span entry-points of other subroutines based upon the possible flows from its' entry- point. @see ghidra.program.model.block.CodeBlockModel @see ghidra.program.model.block.OverlapCodeSubModel @see ghidra.program.model.block.MultEntSubModel

methods.javadoc: Construct a IsolatedEntrySubModel subroutine on a program. @param program program to create blocks from.

name: IsolatedEntrySubModel
comment:
IsolatedEntryCodeSubModel (S-model) defines subroutines with a
 unique entry point, which may share code with other subroutines. Each entry-
 point may either be a source or called entry-point and is identified using
 the MultEntSubModel. This model extends the OverlapCodeSubModel, redefining
 the set of addresses contained within each subroutine. Unlike the
 OverlapCodeSubModel, the address set of a IsolatedEntryCodeSubModel
 subroutine is permitted to span entry-points of other subroutines based upon
 the possible flows from its' entry- point.
